reference.shortdesc: The prereq contains prerequisites. Prerequisites are things that users need to know or preliminary tasks that users need to perform before starting the current task.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Do we want to state somehow that a generated label is really important? If folks don't use a stylesheet that generates labels, often the prereq info is effectively lost.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Processors MAY render prerequisite links from the related-links section together with the content of the prereq element.
section.draft-comment: This seems like one that could be changed from normative MAY to "might"

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The prereq element is specialized from section. It is defined in the task module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample is from a topic that explains how to create an SQLJ file. A prerequisite is to log into the SQLJ server.
example.codeblock: <task id="sqlj"> <title>Creating an SQLJ file</title> <taskbody> <prereq>Before creating a new SQLJ file, you must log in to the SQLJ server.</prereq> <!-- ... --> </taskbody> </task>
example.p: Style sheets might generate a label, for example, Before you begin, to indicate clearly that the prerequisite task needs to be performed before embarking on the procedure.
